dt: {bc}any of various stout-billed passerine birds (families Cardinalidae and Emberizidae) of which some are grouped with the cardinal and some with the New World sparrows {dx}compare {dxt|indigo bunting||}, {dxt|painted bunting||}{/dx}

shortdef: any of various stout-billed passerine birds (families Cardinalidae and Emberizidae) of which some are grouped with the cardinal and some with the New World sparrows

dt: {bc}a lightweight loosely woven fabric used chiefly for flags and festive decorations
{bc}decorations especially in the colors of the national flag

shortdef: a lightweight loosely woven fabric used chiefly for flags and festive decorations
decorations especially in the colors of the national flag

dt: {bc}an infant's hooded garment made of napped fabric

et: term of endearment in the nursery rhyme "Bye, baby bunting"
shortdef: an infant's hooded garment made of napped fabric

dt: {bc}a small finch ({it}Passerina cyanea{/it} of the family Cardinalidae) chiefly of eastern North America of which the male is largely deep blue in spring and summer

shortdef: a small finch (Passerina cyanea of the family Cardinalidae) chiefly of eastern North America of which the male is largely deep blue in spring and summer

dt: {bc}a brightly colored bunting ({it}Passerina ciris{/it}) that is found from the southern U.S. to Panama

shortdef: a brightly colored bunting (Passerina ciris) that is found from the southern U.S. to Panama

dt: {bc}a white bunting ({it}Plectrophenax nivalis{/it}) with black or brown markings on the upperparts that breeds in arctic regions and winters in northern parts of North America and Eurasia

shortdef: a white bunting (Plectrophenax nivalis) with black or brown markings on the upperparts that breeds in arctic regions and winters in northern parts of North America and Eurasia
